title: *HELP* FPS dropped after GTX 1060 upgrade
body:
SPECS:
- AMD A-10 6800k
- GTX 1060 Founders Edition
- Other stuff I don't think matters too much

So I used to have a GTA Nvidia 750 ti and I was able to play League w/o many issues.
I recently ordered my 1060 and installed it the day I got it. Other games received noticeable improvements,
but League seemed to take a turn...

The main problem I'm having regards intensive teamfights. At the state I'm in, it's very difficult to be a
contributing player when my fps takes massive drops whilst in intensive teamfights. It drops from roughly 100-120 all the way
to sometimes 15 fps! (It was never a problem with my 70 ti)

I have no clue why this may be happening, so i really hope I can find some help
Thanks! :)

replies.body:
I'm taking a shot in the dark here, but if you're running Windows 10, then you may have installed the Anniversary update that enabled Game DVR inside the Xbox app. You could [disable the game bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves the issue.

If it doesn't, then you may need to grab a fresh set of driver and ensure you've chosen the **'custom install'** and checked the box for a **'clean driver install'**. Let me know what happens.

Thanks for the reply, really!
I have checked for the Anniversary update, and didn't find anything related to it.
I have also disabled the game bar, and didn't notice a change..

I'm honestly hoping it's the drivers that are causing the issue, but I absolutely have no idea which drivers to focus.
If you could please help me with the drivers, I'd greatly appreciate it.
Thanks!

It definitely could be the video drivers. I built a PC for a mate last night and noticed some strange interactions with getting a working driver on Windows 10 after the Anniversary updates were installed. 

Our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) includes steps for both driver reinstallation along with windows power settings and other super helpful steps. I definitely suggest checking those out and giving them a go.

Let me know if those steps change anything with your FPS.
I was thinking of buying the i5 6600k with the EVGA 1060 6gb SUPER CLOCKED after reading all of your problems i am having second thoughts.??

Same problem here. i have ASUS 1060 6gb and i5 6500, 16 gb ram and i have FPS drops . i play it with 300 FPS and the drop is going down on 9-8 FPS.
The driver is  up to date and the geforce experience optimize the game on very high. The drops are present on each video quality
I also am having the same problem with my evga gtx 1060 sc

The game also randomly freezes for up to 20 seconds, which is a very big issue..
It doesn't happen often, but when it does it's very unpleasant.
